item.description:
As medical-device manufacturers concentrate their efforts on portability, wireless connectivity, home health, safety, data security, quality/reliability and low cost, they are moving rapidly toward embedded software implementations. At the same time, major suppliers in this area are offering more robust products, tools and services to support embedded development.




Although the lifecycle for embedded software development is very similar to that of conventional software, it differs in a few crucial aspects. Efficiency is much more of an issue, since the software is much "closer" to the hardware than conventional software operating on a general purpose computer. As well, real-time processing often imposes serious constraints. For more information, click here.




Presenters:

Mike Attili, VP of Software Development, Fluidnet

Erik Goethert, Program Manager, Boston Engineering





Moderators:

Brian Shoemaker, ShoeBar Associaties

Tony Raymond, New Harbor SQA



Date: November 10, 2010
Time: 5:30 - 9:00pm
Location: Padanarum Room, Reservoir Place, 1601 Trapelo Road, Waltham
Info: bshoemaker@shoebarassoc.com


Meeting Fee (includes a light supper):

Advance On-site
MedDev Group member $15 $20
Nonmember $25 $30




Click here to register for this event.

item.name: "Embedded Design and Development for Medical Applications"
